title: Troubleshooting Valve Issues Using The Armada Pro50

subtasks: Check if the issue is caused by a faulty controller.
Verify the valve is closing properly for a zone that won't stop running.
Inspect for signs of a broken pipe if the zone isn't coming on all the way.
Determine if the valve isn't opening by checking for water seepage from sprinkler heads.
Test the controller's 24-volt output using a solenoid activator or multimeter.
Check for continuity and resistance in the wiring and solenoid using a multimeter.
Verify the module is properly seated in a modular controller.
Check programming errors on the controller.
Replace the valve or solenoid if identified as the faulty component.
If necessary, replace the controller or run new wire for troubleshooting.
